doliprane.name: Doliprane
doliprane.indications: Treatment of mild to moderate pain and/or fever in adults and children over 27kg (approximately 8 years old)
doliprane.dosage: Adults: 500mg to 1000mg per dose, to be renewed if necessary after 4 hours minimum. Do not exceed 4000mg per day. Children: 15mg/kg per dose, every 6 hours.
doliprane.contraindications: Severe liver failure, known allergy to paracetamol
doliprane.side_effects: Rare: skin allergic reactions, changes in blood test results. Very rare: severe liver damage in case of overdose
doliprane.warnings: Do not exceed recommended dose. Risk of severe liver damage in case of overdose. Contains paracetamol - check other medicines being taken to avoid exceeding maximum daily dose
doliprane.drug_interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding risk with chronic paracetamol use), alcohol (increased hepatotoxicity)
doliprane.mechanism_of_action: Inhibits prostaglandin synthesis in the CNS, affecting pain perception and thermoregulation
doliprane.pregnancy_category: B - Generally safe but consult physician
doliprane.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, OTC in most markets

ventoline.name: Ventoline
ventoline.indications: Relief of asthma symptoms, prevention of exercise-induced asthma, treatment of acute asthma attacks
ventoline.dosage: Adults and children over 12: 100 to 200 micrograms (1-2 puffs) as needed. For prevention of exercise-induced asthma: 200 micrograms 10-15 minutes before exercise. Do not exceed 8 puffs in 24 hours.
ventoline.contraindications: Known allergy to salbutamol or any component of the product
ventoline.side_effects: Common: tremor, headache, increased heart rate. Rare: muscle cramps, palpitations. Very rare: paradoxical bronchospasm
ventoline.warnings: If usual dose becomes less effective or relief lasts less than 3 hours, consult a doctor immediately. Not for regular daily use - if needed more than 3 times per week, consult your doctor
ventoline.drug_interactions: Beta-blockers (may reduce effectiveness), MAO inhibitors (cardiovascular effects), diuretics (hypokalemia)
ventoline.mechanism_of_action: Beta-2 adrenergic receptor agonist causing bronchodilation through smooth muscle relaxation
ventoline.pregnancy_category: C - Use only if clearly needed
ventoline.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

advil.name: Advil
advil.indications: Treatment of fever and pain such as headaches, dental pain, muscle aches, period pain. Treatment of painful inflammatory conditions
advil.dosage: Adults and adolescents over 12 years (over 40kg): 200mg to 400mg per dose, to be repeated if necessary after 6 hours. Do not exceed 1200mg per day. Take with food.
advil.contraindications: Active or history of peptic ulcer, severe heart failure, last trimester of pregnancy, allergy to NSAIDs or aspirin, severe kidney or liver failure
advil.side_effects: Common: digestive disorders (nausea, vomiting, diarrhea). Rare: stomach ulcer, allergic reactions. Very rare: severe skin reactions
advil.warnings: Take with food to reduce stomach upset. Increased risk of heart attack and stroke with long-term use. Avoid alcohol consumption. May mask symptoms of infection. Not recommended beyond 3 days for fever or 5 days for pain without medical advice
advil.drug_interactions: Aspirin (increased GI bleeding), ACE inhibitors (reduced efficacy), warfarin (increased bleeding risk), lithium (increased lithium levels)
advil.mechanism_of_action: Non-selective COX-1 and COX-2 inhibitor, reducing prostaglandin synthesis and inflammation
advil.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, OTC up to 400mg

lipitor.name: Lipitor
lipitor.indications: Reduction of elevated total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, apolipoprotein B, and triglycerides. Prevention of cardiovascular disease in patients with multiple risk factors.
lipitor.dosage: Initial: 10-20mg once daily. Maintenance: 10-80mg once daily. Can be taken with or without food, preferably in evening.
lipitor.contraindications: Active liver disease, unexplained persistent elevations of serum transaminases, pregnancy, breastfeeding, hypersensitivity to atorvastatin
lipitor.side_effects: Common: nasopharyngitis, arthralgia, diarrhea, pain in extremity. Uncommon: myalgia, myopathy. Rare: rhabdomyolysis, hepatotoxicity
lipitor.warnings: Monitor liver function tests before and during treatment. Risk of myopathy increases with certain drug combinations. Report unexplained muscle pain immediately. Avoid grapefruit juice.
lipitor.drug_interactions: Grapefruit juice (increased atorvastatin levels), cyclosporine, gemfibrozil (increased myopathy risk), oral contraceptives (increased ethinyl estradiol levels)
lipitor.mechanism_of_action: HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor, reducing cholesterol synthesis in liver and increasing LDL receptor expression
lipitor.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

metformin.name: Metformin
metformin.indications: Treatment of type 2 diabetes mellitus, particularly in overweight patients. First-line therapy in combination with diet and exercise.
metformin.dosage: Initial: 500mg twice daily or 850mg once daily with meals. Maximum: 2550mg/day in divided doses. Extended-release: 500-2000mg once daily with evening meal.
metformin.contraindications: Severe renal impairment (eGFR <30), acute metabolic acidosis, diabetic ketoacidosis, severe infection, dehydration, heart failure requiring drug treatment
metformin.side_effects: Very common: GI disturbances (diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain). Uncommon: lactic acidosis (rare but serious), vitamin B12 deficiency with long-term use
metformin.warnings: Risk of lactic acidosis in renal impairment. Discontinue before contrast imaging procedures. Monitor renal function. Take with food to reduce GI side effects. Supplement vitamin B12 with long-term use.
metformin.drug_interactions: Contrast media (risk of lactic acidosis), alcohol (increased lactic acidosis risk), cationic drugs (cimetidine, amiloride - increased metformin levels)
metformin.mechanism_of_action: Decreases hepatic glucose production, decreases intestinal glucose absorption, improves insulin sensitivity
metformin.pregnancy_category: B - Use during pregnancy only if clearly needed
metformin.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

aspirin.name: Aspirin
aspirin.indications: Pain relief, fever reduction, anti-inflammatory. Low-dose: secondary prevention of cardiovascular events, stroke prevention.
aspirin.dosage: Pain/fever: 325-650mg every 4-6 hours. Maximum 4000mg/day. Cardiovascular prevention: 75-100mg once daily.
aspirin.contraindications: Active peptic ulcer, hemophilia, children under 16 with viral infections (Reye's syndrome risk), third trimester pregnancy, severe renal/hepatic impairment
aspirin.side_effects: Common: GI irritation, heartburn, nausea. Uncommon: GI bleeding, allergic reactions. Rare: Reye's syndrome in children, tinnitus (high doses)
aspirin.warnings: Increased bleeding risk. Take with food. Risk of Reye's syndrome in children with viral infections. May cause bronchospasm in aspirin-sensitive asthmatics.
aspirin.drug_interactions: Warfarin (increased bleeding), other NSAIDs (increased GI toxicity), methotrexate (increased toxicity), ACE inhibitors (reduced efficacy)
aspirin.mechanism_of_action: Irreversible COX inhibition reducing prostaglandin and thromboxane synthesis. Antiplatelet effect through TXA2 inhibition.

synthroid.name: Synthroid
synthroid.indications: Hypothyroidism, thyroid hormone replacement therapy, thyroid cancer (TSH suppression), myxedema coma
synthroid.dosage: Highly individualized. Initial: 25-50mcg daily (12.5mcg in elderly/cardiac patients). Maintenance: 100-200mcg daily. Take on empty stomach 30-60min before breakfast.
synthroid.contraindications: Untreated thyrotoxicosis, acute myocardial infarction, uncorrected adrenal insufficiency
synthroid.side_effects: Usually indicates overdose: palpitations, increased appetite, weight loss, tremor, headache, insomnia, diarrhea. Rare: cardiac arrhythmias
synthroid.warnings: Start with low dose in elderly and cardiac patients. Monitor TSH levels every 6-8 weeks until stable. Do not use for weight loss. Absorption affected by many drugs and supplements.
synthroid.drug_interactions: Iron supplements (decreased absorption), calcium (decreased absorption), antacids (decreased absorption), warfarin (increased anticoagulant effect), antidiabetic drugs (may need dose adjustment)
synthroid.mechanism_of_action: Synthetic T4 hormone replacement, converted to active T3 in peripheral tissues, regulating metabolism
synthroid.pregnancy_category: A - Safe in pregnancy, often needs dose increase
synthroid.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

amoxicillin.name: Amoxicillin
amoxicillin.indications: Bacterial infections: respiratory tract infections, otitis media, sinusitis, urinary tract infections, skin infections, dental infections
amoxicillin.dosage: Adults: 250-500mg every 8 hours or 500-875mg every 12 hours. Children: 20-40mg/kg/day in divided doses. Take with or without food.
amoxicillin.contraindications: Penicillin allergy, history of amoxicillin-associated cholestatic jaundice/hepatic dysfunction
amoxicillin.side_effects: Common: diarrhea, nausea, skin rash. Uncommon: vomiting, Candida overgrowth. Rare: anaphylaxis, pseudomembranous colitis, Stevens-Johnson syndrome
amoxicillin.warnings: Complete full course even if feeling better. May reduce oral contraceptive effectiveness. Risk of C. difficile-associated diarrhea. Higher rash incidence with mononucleosis.
amoxicillin.drug_interactions: Oral contraceptives (reduced effectiveness), allopurinol (increased rash risk), methotrexate (increased methotrexate toxicity), warfarin (may increase INR)
amoxicillin.mechanism_of_action: Beta-lactam antibiotic inhibiting bacterial cell wall synthesis by binding penicillin-binding proteins
amoxicillin.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

zoloft.name: Zoloft
zoloft.indications: Major depressive disorder, obsessive-compulsive disorder, panic disorder, post-traumatic stress disorder, social anxiety disorder, premenstrual dysphoric disorder
zoloft.dosage: Depression/OCD: Initial 50mg daily, may increase to 200mg daily. Panic/PTSD/Social anxiety: Initial 25mg daily, increase to 50-200mg. Take with food, morning or evening.
zoloft.contraindications: MAO inhibitor use within 14 days, pimozide use, hypersensitivity to sertraline
zoloft.side_effects: Common: nausea, diarrhea, insomnia, dry mouth, fatigue, decreased libido, ejaculatory dysfunction. Uncommon: weight changes, hyponatremia. Rare: serotonin syndrome, suicidal ideation
zoloft.warnings: Increased suicide risk in young adults initially. Do not stop abruptly (discontinuation syndrome). May increase bleeding risk. Monitor for serotonin syndrome. May affect sexual function.
zoloft.drug_interactions: MAO inhibitors (serotonin syndrome), other serotonergic drugs, warfarin (increased bleeding), NSAIDs (increased bleeding), antiarrhythmics (QT prolongation)
zoloft.mechanism_of_action: Selective serotonin reuptake inhibition, increasing synaptic serotonin levels
zoloft.pregnancy_category: C - Use only if benefits outweigh risks
zoloft.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, Prescription required

omeprazole.name: Omeprazole
omeprazole.indications: Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcer disease, Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, H. pylori eradication (combination therapy), NSAID-associated ulcer prevention
omeprazole.dosage: GERD: 20mg once daily for 4-8 weeks. Peptic ulcer: 20-40mg once daily. Take 30-60 minutes before first meal of the day.
omeprazole.contraindications: Hypersensitivity to omeprazole or other PPIs, concurrent use with rilpivirine
omeprazole.side_effects: Common: headache, abdominal pain, diarrhea, nausea. Uncommon: vitamin B12 deficiency (long-term), hypomagnesemia, increased fracture risk. Rare: C. difficile infection, lupus-like syndrome
omeprazole.warnings: Long-term use (>1 year) may increase fracture risk, vitamin B12 deficiency, hypomagnesemia. May mask gastric cancer symptoms. Increased C. difficile risk. Not for immediate heartburn relief.
omeprazole.drug_interactions: Clopidogrel (reduced antiplatelet effect), methotrexate (increased levels), digoxin (increased absorption), warfarin (may increase INR), atazanavir (reduced absorption)
omeprazole.mechanism_of_action: Irreversible proton pump (H+/K+ ATPase) inhibition in gastric parietal cells, reducing acid secretion
omeprazole.pregnancy_category: C - Use if benefits outweigh risks
omeprazole.regulatory_status: FDA approved, EMA approved, OTC (lower doses) and Prescription

metadata.compliance_note: This database contains pharmaceutical information for educational and reference purposes. Always consult healthcare professionals for medical advice.
